children.name: all of the subjects as part of your work at school or university
syllabus
children.definition: a plan that states exactly what should be taught to students who are studying a subject, especially a list of what they may be tested on in their examinations: chương trình học, giáo án
examples: The summer term was very short and the teacher didn’t manage to cover the whole syllabus
the first-year syllabus
be on the syllabusbe part of the syllabuscó trong giáo án/chương trình học
We have to study algebra -- it’s on the syllabus for the course.

children.name: curriculum
children.definition: the range of subjects that has been officially chosen to be taught at a school or at all schools in a country: chương trình học
examples: Languages are an essential part of the school curriculum.

children.name: the school curriculum
examples: The children carried out the project as part of the school curriculum.

children.name: the National Curriculum
children.definition: the curriculum set by the government for schools in England and Wales

children.name: the primary/secondary/high school etc curriculum
children.definition: for particular ages at school

children.name: the undergraduate curriculum
children.definition: for a first degree at university or college

children.name: the science/maths/history etc curriculum
examples: The English curriculum is divided into Language and Literature.

children.name: a core/common curriculum
children.definition: the subjects that everyone must study because they are considered very important
examples: There has been a lot of debate on the content of the core curriculum.

children.name: an academic curriculum
children.definition: involving studying from books, not practical subjects
examples: They unquestioningly accept the traditional academic curriculum.

children.name: a broad/broad-based/wide curriculum
children.definition: involving a wide range of different types of subjects
examples: The school provides a broad curriculum with a rich choice of learning opportunities.

children.name: balanced
children.definition: with a mix of academic and practical subjects
examples: We want to ensure a balanced curriculum for all pupils.

children.name: narrow
children.definition: not broad enough
examples: Many teachers complained that the new curriculum was too narrow.

children.name: plan/develop/design a curriculum
examples: Fifty academics have been involved in developing the new school curriculum.

children.name: follow a curriculum
children.definition: study the subjects that are in a curriculum
examples: Five-year-olds now follow the National Curriculum.

children.name: curriculum planning
examples: on the curriculumBritish English:
IT is now on the curriculum in most schools.
in the curriculumAmerican English:
Students are exempt from some classes in the curriculum for religious reasons.

children.name: a series of lessons on a particular subject
course
children.definition: /classUS  a series of lessons on a subject, often with an examination at the end: khóa học
examples: Are you enjoying the course?
a schedule of the classes for the fall semester
The college is offering three basic computer courses this year.
course in/on
She began a 12 week course on modern art.
an elementary/intermediate/advanced coursean advanced course in art and design
a college/university coursestudents who fail their college courses
COMMON ERRORS
►Do not say 'make a course'. Saydoortake a course.

children.name: a language/art/design etc course
examples: The school runs ten-week language courses three times a year.

children.name: a full-time/part-time course
examples: There are also part-time courses for mature students.

children.name: a one-year/two-year etc course
examples: She did a one-year teacher training course.

children.name: a short course
examples: I did a short course on website design.

children.name: an intensive course
children.definition: in which you learn a lot in a short time
examples: An intensive course in Russian is provided for those who do not already know the language.

children.name: a crash courseinformal
children.definition: in which you learn a great deal in a very short time
examples: A husband was given a crash course in how to deliver a baby by a midwife on the phone.

children.name: a training course
examples: If you are offered the job, you will attend a two-week training course.

children.name: a vocational course
children.definition: that trains you to do a particular job
examples: a vocational course in architecture

children.name: a degree courseBritish English
children.definition: alsoan undergraduate course
examples: (= a first course at a university, which usually lasts three years )a three-year degree course

children.name: a postgraduate courseBritish English
children.definition: one you do after your first degree course

children.name: a correspondence course
children.definition: in which you work at home, sending work to a teacher by post

children.name: an introductory course
children.definition: for people who have never done a particular subject or activity before

children.name: an induction course
children.definition: that you do when you start a new job or position

children.name: a refresher course
children.definition: short and intended to teach you about new developments in a subject

children.name: a foundation courseBritish English
children.definition: a general course that students do in the first year at some universities

children.name: a sandwich courseBritish English
children.definition: that includes periods of work in industry or business

children.name: a tailor-made course
children.definition: one that is specially designed for someone
examples: a tailor-made course to help senior staff develop their negotiation skills

children.name: take a course
children.definition: alsodo a courseUK
examples: I decided to do a course in Italian.

children.name: go on a course
examples: UK My company wanted me to go on a course in management skills.

children.name: pass/fail a course
examples: If you pass the course, you get a diploma in psychology.

children.name: apply for a course
examples: The following year she applied for a nursing course.

children.name: enrol on a course/put your name down for a courseUK
children.definition: to arrange to officially join a course
examples: How about enrolling on a sailing course?

children.name: attend a courseformal
children.definition: take part in a course
examples: You’ll have to attend a course on how to deal with customers on the phone.

children.name: withdraw from a course/drop out of a course
children.definition: leave it without finishing it
examples: She had to withdraw from the course because of illness.

children.name: teach a course
examples: She is teaching an introductory course in Russian.

children.name: run a course
examples: The course is run by the British Council.

children.name: offer a course
examples: The course is offered on a part-time basis.

children.name: change
children.definition: your
examples: course(= at university or college )Some students choose to change their course after the first year.

children.name: a course tutor
examples: BrE: I discussed it with my course tutor.

children.name: course material
examples: Teachers are provided with course material.

children.name: the course syllabus
children.definition: the plan of what is taught on a course
examples: The school has recently introduced a new course syllabus.

children.name: homework
children.definition: the work that a student has to do at home as part of their studies: bài tập về nhà
examples: My brother always used to help me with my homework.

children.name: for homework
examples: For homework, I’d like you to finish exercises 2 and 3 on page 24.

children.name: English/geography etc homework
examples: Dave, have you done your French homework?

children.name: do (your) homework
examples: I’m sorry Gail, but Amber has to stay home and do her homework.

children.name: have homework
examples: I don’t have any homework tonight.
Have you got a lot of homework then?

children.name: schoolwork
children.definition: all the work that a student has to do for their studies: bài tập
examples: Johnny’s had a lot of problems at home recently and it’s starting to affect his schoolwork.
The program combines schoolwork with job experience.
Tim, a third-grader, had difficulty with his schoolwork, and also found it hard to make friends.

children.name: classwork
children.definition: the work that a student doeswhen they are at school, rather than work they do at home: bài tập trên lớp
examples: Mrs Hoffmann, I’m calling about Mike’s classwork. There are some problems.
The units are ideal for classwork, but can also be used by students at home.

children.name: coursework
children.definition: the work that a student has to dofor the coursethat they are studying, especially when this is compared with work done in examinations: bài tập (hơn là bài kiểm tra)
examples: Half of the marks are for the exam, the rest are for coursework.
None of the coursework seemed to have much relevance to being a nurse in a busy hospital.
I’m just so behind on the coursework.
The diploma requires 30 hours of coursework.
Half of the marks are for the exam, and half are for coursework.

children.name: studies
children.definition: the work that a student does at a school or university: việc học hành

children.name: sb’s studies
examples: After the war, he resumed his studies at the University of Turin.
Her parents insisted that she give up the vacation job, as they felt it was interfering with her studies.

children.name: finish/complete your studies
examples: After completing her studies at the University, she worked as a nurse for six years.

children.name: project
children.definition: a part of a school or college course that involves careful study of a particular subject over a period of time: đề án nghiên cứu
examples: a geography project
project on
We’redoingaprojecton pollution.
He'sdoinga class projectonpollution.
In our third year at college everyone had to do a special project.

children.name: the period of time during which a class is taught
class
children.definition: a period of time, usually about30 minutes to one hour,in which a teacher teaches a group of students: tiết học
examples: Heidi fainted during French class today!
Let’s go - I have my first class in 10 minutes!

children.name: lesson
children.definition: a period in which sb teaches one person or a group of people - use this especially about practical skills such as music, swimming, or driving, or in UK about a class in a school: bài học
examples: Dominic will be having his first driving lesson this Thursday.
She gives English lessons to business people in the evenings.

children.name: period
children.definition: one of the periods of time that a school day is divided into: tiết học
examples: At our school we have four periods in the morning and three in the afternoon.

children.name: double period British one class which lasts for two periods
examples: On Monday mornings there was French, English, and then a double period of maths.

children.name: session
children.definition: the period of time in which a particular subject or a particular area of a subject is taught, especially when this is one of a fixed number of classes:
examples: We have 5 hours of English a week, including one session in the language laboratory.

children.name: lecture
children.definition: a long talk on a particular subject that sb gives to a group of people, especially to students in a university: bài diễn thuyết, bài giảng

children.name: give a lecture
children.definition: alsodeliver a lectureformal
examples: She gave a fascinating lecture on crime in the 1800s.|He delivered the lecture at the London School of Economics.

children.name: do a lectureinformal:
examples: He’s doing a lecture on modern poetry.

children.name: go to a lecture
children.definition: alsoattend a lectureformal
examples: Have you been to any of Professor MacPherson’s lectures?|I recently attended a lecture by a noted historian.

children.name: listen to a lecture
examples: Most students spend about a quarter of their time listening to lectures.

children.name: a lecture hall/room
children.definition: alsoa lecture theatreBritish English
examples: The lecture hall was packed.

children.name: lecture notes
examples: Can I borrow your lecture notes?

children.name: a lecture tour
children.definition: a trip that someone takes to many different places to give a lecture
examples: He’s on a lecture tour of the US.

children.name: a series of lectures
children.definition: alsoa course of lecturesBritish English
examples: a series of lectures on the history of art

children.name: a public lecture
children.definition: a lecture which the general public are allowed to go to
examples: He’s going to deliver a public lecture on politics in the Middle East.

children.name: an illustrated lecture
children.definition: a lecture with pictures such as slides
examples: Mrs Robinson gave a fascinating illustrated lecture on Spanish history.

children.name: lecture on
examples: He regularly gives lectures on modern French literature.
We went to a lectureonItalian art.

children.name: seminar
children.definition: an occasion when a teacher or expert and a group of people meet to study and discuss something: hội thảo
examples: Iattendedpractically every lecture and seminar when I was a student.
a seminarroom
seminar on
Every week we have a seminar on modern political theory.
I'mgivinga seminaronthe latest developments in genetic engineering next week.

children.name: tutorial
children.definition: a regular class at a UK college or university during which a teacher discusses a particular subject with one student or with a small group of students: buổi hướng dẫn
examples: Small group tutorials are used to discuss problems which come up in lectures.
Oxford’s one-to-one tutorials are an effective but also costly way of teaching.

children.name: a course of study that you do quickly
rapid
children.definition: cấp tốc
examples: The college offers a rapid programme of training for librarians.
Rapid learning: Learn to speak a new language in 12 weeks!

children.name: intensive
children.definition: an intensive course of study is one in which you are taught a lot in a short time: cấp tốc
examples: Before moving to Paris, Michael went on an intensive course to improve his French.
After a brief period of intensive training, I was allowed to make my first parachute jump.

children.name: crash course
children.definition: a course of study in which you learn a particular skill in a very short time in order to prepare yourself for a job: khóa cấp tốc
examples: I did / took a crash course in French before my trip to Paris.
Students lacking math and science skills take a seven-week crash course during the summer.

children.name: crash course in
examples: We offer crash courses in word processing.

children.name: credit
children.definition: a unit which represents a successfully finished part of an educational course: học phần, tín chỉ
examples: He's already got a credit/ three credits in earth science.

children.name: workshop
children.definition: a meeting at which people try to improve their skills by discussing their experiences and doing practical exercises: hội thảo

children.name: a writers’/drama/music etc workshop
examples: They held a number of music workshops and seminars.
The local councilrunsa stress-management workshop.
